skill.name: using-superpowers
skill.description: Use when starting any conversation - establishes how to find and use skills, requiring Skill tool invocation before ANY response including clarifying questions
skill.summary: Use when starting any conversation - establishes how to find and use skills, requiring Skill tool in...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and workflow guidance. No executable code, file system access, network calls, or environment variable access. Safe for distribution.

content.value_statement: Claude may miss specialized skills when responding to user requests. This skill enforces mandatory skill checking before any response, ensuring optimal task execution using available capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Enforces skill check before any response
Requires Skill tool invocation for applicable tasks
Creates TodoWrite todos for skill checklists
Distinguishes rigid vs flexible skill types
limitations: Requires users to have relevant skills installed
Cannot execute code or access files directly
Only affects Claude behavior, not external systems

use_cases.title: Enforce skill discipline
use_cases.description: Ensure Claude always uses installed skills before responding to complex tasks

use_cases.title: Standardize workflows
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill usage patterns across team interactions

use_cases.title: Guarantee skill adoption
use_cases.description: Ensure users follow your skill's prescribed workflow and checklists

prompt_templates.title: General task
prompt_templates.prompt: Use using-superpowers skill to help me with [task description]

prompt_templates.title: Complex project
prompt_templates.prompt: Check available skills using using-superpowers, then help me build [project description]

prompt_templates.title: Debugging session
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply using-superpowers skill, then help me debug [issue description]

prompt_templates.title: Code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use using-superpowers workflow to review changes in [file or PR]

output_examples.input: Help me refactor this Python file to use async/await
output: Using 'using-superpowers' to ensure proper skill invocation
No specific refactoring skill found, proceeding with general async patterns
I can help you refactor your Python code to use async/await. Let me see your code first.

best_practices: Invoke this skill at the start of every conversation
Allow Claude to announce which skill it is using
Follow skill checklists exactly for rigid skills
Adapt flexible skills to your specific context
anti_patterns: Skipping skill check to save time on simple tasks
Ignoring skill workflows for quick clarifications
Assuming you remember a skill without reading current version
Proceeding without skill invocation when 1% chance applies

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires Skill tool support.

faq.question: What happens if no skills apply to my task?
faq.answer: Claude will respond normally. Only invokes skills when at least 1% relevance exists.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: This skill runs first, then invokes applicable skills in priority order: process before implementation.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: None. Pure prompt-based workflow enforcement with no data access or storage.

faq.question: Why is my skill not being invoked?
faq.answer: Ensure you invoke using-superpowers first. Check that your skill is installed and applicable.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual skill selection?
faq.answer: Enforces consistency. Removes rationalization and ensures skills are not skipped for simple tasks.
